DCL Project Configuration Settings

Send comments on this topic.
These preprocessor symbols are typically defined in dclconf.h and define the compilation characteristics for the code built by the project.

Summary

DCLCONF_COMMAND_SHELL   Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether the Datalight command shell functionality should be enabled.
DCLCONF_HIGHRESTIMESTAMP   Set to TRUE to map the regular millisecond based timestamp functions onto the high-res timestamp functions.
DCLCONF_OUTPUT_ENABLED   Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether the driver should support output.
DCLOUTPUT_BUFFERLEN   Sets the maximum size of any single output message.
DCLOUTPUT_THREADID   Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether each message should contain a thread ID.
DCLOUTPUT_TIMESTAMP   Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether each message should contain a time stamp.
DCLTRACEMASK   Specify the bitmapped mask of DCL trace settings to enable.
DCL_SERVICES   DCL_SERVICES defines the set of services to create when a project is initialized.

DCLCONF_COMMAND_SHELL

Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether the Datalight command shell functionality should be enabled.

DCLCONF_HIGHRESTIMESTAMP

Set to TRUE to map the regular millisecond based timestamp functions onto the high-res timestamp functions.

This may ONLY be done if the high-res timestamp functions are implemented (oshrtick.c), and have a period long enough to be meaningful (some high-res timers wrap too fast to be useful).

DCLCONF_OUTPUT_ENABLED

Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether the driver should support output. This is the master switch which can be used to all messages, both RELEASE and DEBUG mode. In some environments which are memory constrained, this setting can be used to reduce the code size and memory requirements.

DCLOUTPUT_BUFFERLEN

Sets the maximum size of any single output message. Any message which is longer than this value will either be truncated or broken into two messages. Buffer of this size may be allocated on the stack so beware of making this setting too large.

This setting is only meaningful if DCLCONF_OUTPUT_ENABLED is set to TRUE.

DCLOUTPUT_THREADID

Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether each message should contain a thread ID. This is typically set to FALSE by default, but can be useful for debugging multithreaded issues. Note that enabling this feature has the side effect of causing each output message to be handled atomically.

This setting is only meaningful if DCLCONF_OUTPUT_ENABLED is set to TRUE.

DCLOUTPUT_TIMESTAMP

Set to TRUE or FALSE to indicate whether each message should contain a time stamp. This is typically set to FALSE by default. Note that enabling this feature has the side effect of causing each output message to be handled atomically.

This setting is only meaningful if DCLCONF_OUTPUT_ENABLED is set to TRUE.

DCLTRACEMASK

Specify the bitmapped mask of DCL trace settings to enable. See dltrace.h. Defaults to DCLTRACEBIT_NONE.

DCL_SERVICES

DCL_SERVICES defines the set of services to create when a project is initialized. Each entry is a function pointer to the initializer function for a given service. Services are created in the order specified, and at shutdown time, are destroyed in reverse order.

The predefined macro "DCL_OS_DEFAULT_SERVICES" is defined to the default set of services for each supported OS environment, and can be found in the appropriate dlosconf.h.

OEMs can modify this list to add or remove Datalight services, or add OEM specific services.
